intro: Bassia brachyptera, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in disturbed or open habitats. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads, which are characteristic of the Amaranthaceae family. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Bassia brachyptera is also known for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in sandy areas.
